Package org.northcoder.titlewebdemo.util

Class StringCleanser

extends java.lang.Object
    Removes or replaces selected characters from an input string.

      static java.lang.String cleanse​(java.lang.String input)
      Removes or replaces selected characters from the user-provided string, to ensure standardized data is saved - for example, the Microsoft "smart" apostrophe (’) is replaced by the standard ASCII apostrophe (').

    • Method Detail

      • cleanse

        public static java.lang.String cleanse​(java.lang.String input)
        Removes or replaces selected characters from the user-provided string, to ensure standardized data is saved - for example, the Microsoft "smart" apostrophe (’) is replaced by the standard ASCII apostrophe ('). One common source of such characters is data which is copy/pasted from Microsoft Office documents.

        If the input is null, then null is returned.

        The following are cleansed:

        Whitespace characters replaced by standard space character:

        • U+00A0 (non-breaking space)

        Microsoft smart characters replaced by standard equivalents:

        • U+201A (curved single quote) --> U+0027 (apostrophe)
        • U+2018 (curved single quote) --> U+0027 (apostrophe)
        • U+2019 (curved single quote) --> U+0027 (apostrophe)
        • U+201E (curved double quote) --> U+0022 (quotation)
        • U+201C (curved double quote) --> U+0022 (quotation)
        • U+201D (curved double quote) --> U+0022 (quotation).
        • U+2013 (dash) --> U+002D (hyphen)
        • U+2014 (dash) --> U+002D (hyphen)

        Control characters removed:

        • U+007F (delete)
        • U+0080 through U+009F (C1 controls)

        Misc. Others --> Replacement Character

        • U+2015 (horizontal bar) --> U+002D (hyphen)

        Finally, the string is trimmed using the standard Java trim method.

        Parameters:
        input - the string prior to cleansing
        Returns:
        the cleansed string
